results.name: Smallest prime of the form (2*n+1)*prime(k)-2*n, any k.
comment: The associated prime(k) are in A136019.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(1)=7 because 7 is smallest prime p such that (p+2)/3 is prime
a(2)=11 because 11 is smallest prime p such that (p+4)/5 is prime
a(3)=29 because 29 is smallest prime p such that (p+6)/7 is prime
mathematica: a = {}; Do[k = 1; While[ !PrimeQ[(Prime[k] + 2n)/(2n + 1)], k++ ]; AppendTo[a, Prime[k]], {n, 1, 100}]; a
Reap[Do[k = PrimePi[2n+1]; While[ !PrimeQ[((p=Prime[k]) + 2n)/(2n + 1)], k++ ]; Sow[p], {n, 100}]][[2,1]] (* _Zak Seidov_, Mar 04 2013 *)
